xwikidoc.author: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #phenotips on 19 March 2014
xwikidoc.content: <sdumitriu> has joined #phenotips 01:34 <tian2992> has joined #phenotips 02:31 <sdumitriu> has quit 02:32 <ruthgrace> has quit 02:51 <Shubham1> has quit 06:08 <mcupak> has quit 07:22 <SayAsh_> has joined #phenotips 07:22 <SayAsh_> has quit 07:55 <CARAM> has quit 10:10 <bvancea> has joined #phenotips 10:33 <aw1231> has joined #phenotips 10:36 <aw1231> sdumitriu_[Away]: Correct me if I'm wrong, but you want my proposal to connect symptoms to diseases. 10:52 <bvancea> has quit 10:53 <punnu> has quit 12:53 <Shubham2> has quit 13:10 <sdumitriu_[Away]> is now known as <sdumitriu> 13:11 <sdumitriu> Hey aw1231 14:47 <tian2992> hello 15:27 <Shubham> has quit 15:41 <Shubham> has quit 15:55 <sdumitriu> Hi tian2992 15:56 <tian2992> sdumitriu: hi, I was checking out phenotips 15:56 <tian2992> for GSoC 15:56 <tian2992> I was trying to work on https://github.com/phenotips/phenotips/issues/756 15:56 <tian2992> but I can't find where is the list actually fetched 15:57 <tian2992> I found https://github.com/phenotips/phenotips/blob/master/components/patient-data/ui/src/main/resources/PhenoTips/UIX_Field__phenotype.xml and the PhenoTips.YesNoNAPicker component 15:57 <sdumitriu> Did you try Firebug or other Developer Tools? 15:57 <tian2992> I'm still building phenotips so I don't have it running yet 15:59 <sdumitriu> So, to make sure you're looking for the right thing, "Suggested terms" refers to the "You might want to check for..." area, for example on http://playground.phenotips.org/bin/edit/data/P0000060#HClinicalsymptomsandphysicalfindings 16:01 <tian2992> ohh 16:04 <tian2992> so it is related to the DiffDiagnosisService 16:05 <Shubham> has quit 16:10 <sdumitriu> Yes 16:11 <tian2992> I see now that it is connected to _service.getDifferentialPhenotypes 16:12 <tian2992> but there I see both the hpoa Predictor and PhenotypeMappingScriptService.java 16:12 <tian2992> yet I don't see the implementation 16:13 <tian2992> ohh, I see the AbstractPredictor.java has it 16:14 <sdumitriu> You're on the right track 16:14 <tian2992> I got a Failed to execute goal org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-tool-packager-plugin:5.4.2:import (default) on project database-zip: Execution default of goal org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-tool-packager-plugin:5.4.2:import failed: A required class was missing while executing org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-tool-packager-plugin:5.4.2:import: Lorg/sonatype/aether/RepositorySystemSession; 16:15 <tian2992> when building on my machine 16:16 <sdumitriu> You need to use Maven 3.0 16:16 <tian2992> I'm using maven 3.2.1 16:16 <sdumitriu> That's a bug in one of the Maven plugins we use, it doesn't work with recent versions of Maven 16:16 <tian2992> should I downgrade? 16:16 <sdumitriu> Yes 16:16 <tian2992> oh, ok 16:17 <ruthgrace> has quit 16:22 <mcupak> has quit 16:23 <sdumitriu> Cool, somebody's improving the documentation 16:23 <sdumitriu> Thank you tian2992 16:23 <tian2992> i'm Sebsatian Oliva ;P 16:23 <sdumitriu> Yeah, figured out 16:29 <Shubham> has quit 16:57 <ruthgrace> has quit 17:12 <Shubham> has quit 17:16 <tian2992> I don't know, as ICPredictor seems to be filtering for Phenotypes in getPhenotypesWithAnnotation 17:23 <ruthgrace> has quit 17:30 <akats> sdumitriu: So I ran into a little dilemma on my end. The version of HTTPClient that is currently used by phenotips is 4.2.5. Some of the basic parts that I need from it are now deprecated, and the latest version does them in a different way (for example instantiating the client). Should I stick with the 4.2.5 or introduce 4.3.2/4.3.3? 17:33 <sdumitriu> I wonder if 4.3 is backwards compatible 17:33 <sdumitriu> Meaning that other parts of XWiki use 4.2, and maybe third party libraries use 4.2 17:34 <sdumitriu> Check the release notes 17:34 <sdumitriu> They usually say if it's compatible or not 17:34 <akats> ok one sec 17:35 <aw1231> sdumitriu: hey, sorry I keep missing you. Are you available? 17:35 <sdumitriu> Yes 17:36 <aw1231> Good. So, I am just having trouble grasping the scope of the project, and i am honestly probably missing something obvious. 17:41 <aw1231> What exactly is the project supposed to accomplish during the summer? 17:41 <akats> sdumitriu: I don't see it in the release notes. Would it be terrible to have both? Is that even possible, actually? But if I had to guess, I'd say they are compatible. http://www.apache.org/dist/httpcomponents/httpclient/RELEASE_NOTES-4.3.x.txt 17:45 <sdumitriu> Yes, they look compatible 17:45 <sdumitriu> A few classes are deprecated, but not removed 17:45 <sdumitriu> So you should just update 17:46 <sdumitriu> aw1231: Can you wait a few more minutes? 17:46 <sdumitriu> I'm in the middle of a discussion 17:46 <aw1231> Sure 17:51 <Shubham> has quit 18:17 <Shubham> has quit 18:23 <sdumitriu> aw1231: Sorry, this discussion is taking longer... 18:24 <aw1231> It's fine, I might have to go here shortly though 18:59 <sdumitriu> aw1231: Still here? 19:00 <sdumitriu> tian2992: How's it going? 19:02 <tian2992> sdumitriu: I saw the IC predictor, and it seems to implement getPhenotypesWithAnnotation properly 19:02 <sdumitriu> Let me check 19:41 <akats> sdumitriu: I think I found a privacy issue in the server response specifications 19:57 <Shubham> has quit 20:01 <Shubham> has quit 20:02 <akats> has quit 21:25 <tweety098> has quit 22:22 <Shubham> has quit
